item.title: My Bubble Gum World - Mi Mundo de Chicle
item.description: My Bubble Gum World - Mi Mundo de Chicle Here's all the work I've been doing these last years about a very personal world, all made of gum. I hope you like it! Check for more at: http://www.flickr.com/aleixgordohostau http://www.facebook.com/Aleix.Gordo.Hostau.Ilustracion ------------------------------ Aquí os dejo todo el trabajo que he estado haciendo los últimos años acerca de un mundo muy personal mío hecho todo de chicle. Espero que os guste! Para más información visita: http://www.flickr.com/aleixgordohostau http://www.facebook.com/Aleix.Gordo.Hostau.Ilustracion

item.title: OBRAS MAESTRAS (MASTERPIECES)
item.description: La Fábricas Obras Maestras (Masterpieces) is a deluxe edition collection of large format monographic books that offer a thorough analysis on the life and work of the most important Spanish contemporary photographers. The collection, which was created in 2009, comes out every six months.
item.content:encoded: La Fábricas Obras Maestras (Masterpieces) is a deluxe edition collection of large format monographic books that offer a thorough analysis on the life and work of the most important Spanish contemporary photographers. The collection, which was created in 2009, comes out every six months.

item.title: Wippo Resin Toys
item.description: Wippo, is my upcoming resin toy produced by CircusPosterus. Wippo is 5 inch tall and there will be a few different colorways released. Wippo will have his debut at the "Le Carnaval des Spectres" exhibition at Artoyz Paris. Launching September 13th and exhibiting thru October 20th 2012 the exhibition will feature artists from the Circus Posterus collective, Kathie Olivas, Brandt Peters, Travis Louie, Chris Ryniak, Amanda Louise Spayd.
item.content:encoded: Wippo, is my upcoming resin toy produced by CircusPosterus. Wippo is 5 inch tall and there will be a few different colorways released. Wippo will have his debut at the "Le Carnaval des Spectres" exhibition at Artoyz Paris. Launching September 13th and exhibiting thru October 20th 2012 the exhibition will feature artists from the Circus Posterus collective, Kathie Olivas, Brandt Peters, Travis Louie, Chris Ryniak, Amanda Louise Spayd.

item.title: Bobo Logo and Teaser Website
item.description: Logodesign & teaser website for the new Harvard based start up Bobo Analytics. "Bobo? stands for heart rate (bobo-bobo-bobo...). By pairing continuous heart rate and activity monitors with high-level data analysis, we are creating a feedback tool to help you understand your exercise and your daily life."
item.content:encoded: Logodesign & teaser website for the new Harvard based start up Bobo Analytics. "Bobo? stands for heart rate (bobo-bobo-bobo...). By pairing continuous heart rate and activity monitors with high-level data analysis, we are creating a feedback tool to help you understand your exercise and your daily life."

item.title: Steidl - The Robert Frank Project
item.description: "The Robert Frank Project" is an ambitious long term publishing programme which encompasses Robert Franks complete oeuvre - reprints of his classic books, reprints of some rare small books, the publication of previously unseen projects, newly conceived bookworks, and his "Complete Film Works" in specially designed collectors DVD box. This ensures the legacy of this original and seminal artist and that Robert Franks work will be available and accessible for many years to come in a scheme and to a standard that the artist himself has overseen. The publication of a new edition of The Americans on May 15th, 2008, the fiftieth anniversary of the first edition, is the fulcrum of "The Robert Frank Project". It presaged a major touring exhibition and accompanying catalogue from the National Gallery of Art, Washington D.C., Looking In: Robert Franks The Americans, which opened in January 2009. Robert Frank discussed with his publisher, Gerhard Steidl, the idea of producing a new version using modern scanning and the finest tritone printing. The starting point was to bring the original prints to Göttingen, Germany, where Steidl is based, from New York. In July, 2007, Frank visited Göttingen. A new format for the book was worked out and new typography selected. A new cover was designed and Frank personally chose the book cloth, foil for embossing and the endpaper. Most significantly, in the process of working out the layout of the photographs on the page, Frank chose to reproduce un-cropped examples of the photographs when available. Two images were changed completely from the original 1958 and 1959 editions. Then, on a sunny day in July of 2007, the presses started rolling and Robert Frank personally supervised the printing of this latest edition of "The Americans". The brochures contain details of all the books and films which are currently available and those planned for the future. I was involved on the Art Direction and Editorial Management of the project, together with Robert Frank, Gerhard Steidl, Ute Eskildsen and film editor advisor Laura Israel. This project was scanned, designed, produced and printed in-house at Steidl Verlag in Gottingën, Germany.
item.content:encoded: "The Robert Frank Project" is an ambitious long term publishing programme which encompasses Robert Franks complete oeuvre - reprints of his classic books, reprints of some rare small books, the publication of previously unseen projects, newly conceived bookworks, and his "Complete Film Works" in specially designed collectors DVD box. This ensures the legacy of this original and seminal artist and that Robert Franks work will be available and accessible for many years to come in a scheme and to a standard that the artist himself has overseen. The publication of a new edition of The Americans on May 15th, 2008, the fiftieth anniversary of the first edition, is the fulcrum of "The Robert Frank Project". It presaged a major touring exhibition and accompanying catalogue from the National Gallery of Art, Washington D.C., Looking In: Robert Franks The Americans, which opened in January 2009. Robert Frank discussed with his publisher, Gerhard Steidl, the idea of producing a new version using modern scanning and the finest tritone printing. The starting point was to bring the original prints to Göttingen, Germany, where Steidl is based, from New York. In July, 2007, Frank visited Göttingen. A new format for the book was worked out and new typography selected. A new cover was designed and Frank personally chose the book cloth, foil for embossing and the endpaper. Most significantly, in the process of working out the layout of the photographs on the page, Frank chose to reproduce un-cropped examples of the photographs when available. Two images were changed completely from the original 1958 and 1959 editions. Then, on a sunny day in July of 2007, the presses started rolling and Robert Frank personally supervised the printing of this latest edition of "The Americans". The brochures contain details of all the books and films which are currently available and those planned for the future. I was involved on the Art Direction and Editorial Management of the project, together with Robert Frank, Gerhard Steidl, Ute Eskildsen and film editor advisor Laura Israel. This project was scanned, designed, produced and printed in-house at Steidl Verlag in Gottingën, Germany.

item.title: Latest Revival | Hugo & Marie
item.description: Latest Revival is a luxury jewelry e-commerce site offering an editorial perspective on a multi-brand range featuring Chanel, Yves Saint Laurent, Hermès, as well as newcomers Delfina Delettrez, Monique Péan, Eddie Borgo, Irene Neuwirth, and Gaia Repossi. Designed to suit collectors seeking the ultimate piece, founder Dalia Oberlander and her team hand select a range of stunning vintage rarities and new gems. We chose to treat the site like a jewel box - a menagerie of content ranging from exclusive collaborations, products as artifacts, and a broad range of shippable editorial content. Hugo & Marie directed, designed, and developed a top to bottom e-commerce website with a custom hybrid platform to suit the dynamic nature of the site's experience.
item.content:encoded: Latest Revival is a luxury jewelry e-commerce site offering an editorial perspective on a multi-brand range featuring Chanel, Yves Saint Laurent, Hermès, as well as newcomers Delfina Delettrez, Monique Péan, Eddie Borgo, Irene Neuwirth, and Gaia Repossi. Designed to suit collectors seeking the ultimate piece, founder Dalia Oberlander and her team hand select a range of stunning vintage rarities and new gems. We chose to treat the site like a jewel box - a menagerie of content ranging from exclusive collaborations, products as artifacts, and a broad range of shippable editorial content. Hugo & Marie directed, designed, and developed a top to bottom e-commerce website with a custom hybrid platform to suit the dynamic nature of the site's experience.

item.title: Diamonds (Typefamily)
item.description: The Diamonds type family was designed by Hannes von Döhren in 2012. It is an experimental search for geometric new letterforms, which are still easy to read and generate some unexpected attention.

item.title: IIT McCormick Tribune Campus Center
item.description: When the Office for Metropolitan Architecture won the competition to build a new student center on the Illinois Institute of Technology campus, they chose the area wedged under the elevated railroad track that bisected the campus. The project included creating a 530-foot long sound-dampening tunnel atop a block sized one-story building, to contain the noise of the trains overhead. To channel the collegiate exuberance of the student center, and tie into the unique nature and flavor of campus life, our identity for the building uses a quirky signage system, using the familiar, lifeless round-headed icons common to any public building. But in this setting they have walked away from their tedious, regulated lives to portray a wide range of student activities some more real than others. The icon system is integrated into a wide range of surfaces throughout the project: digital murals, fritted glass walls, textured and lenticular wallpapers. We also created unique architectural details, including LED digital clocks, florescent tube chandeliers, woodgrain walls, a sixty-foot long light box, and an iconographic wallpaper portrait of Mies van der Rohe, which is now part of the permanent collection of MoMA.
item.content:encoded: When the Office for Metropolitan Architecture won the competition to build a new student center on the Illinois Institute of Technology campus, they chose the area wedged under the elevated railroad track that bisected the campus. The project included creating a 530-foot long sound-dampening tunnel atop a block sized one-story building, to contain the noise of the trains overhead. To channel the collegiate exuberance of the student center, and tie into the unique nature and flavor of campus life, our identity for the building uses a quirky signage system, using the familiar, lifeless round-headed icons common to any public building. But in this setting they have walked away from their tedious, regulated lives to portray a wide range of student activities some more real than others. The icon system is integrated into a wide range of surfaces throughout the project: digital murals, fritted glass walls, textured and lenticular wallpapers. We also created unique architectural details, including LED digital clocks, florescent tube chandeliers, woodgrain walls, a sixty-foot long light box, and an iconographic wallpaper portrait of Mies van der Rohe, which is now part of the permanent collection of MoMA.
